I'll only update the changelog if the time for merging comes, to avoid conflicts

labels.name: type: improvement
labels.description: An improvement or change to an existing feature.

title: Derive Serialize for NetConnection

labels.name: type: improvement
labels.description: An improvement or change to an existing feature.

body:
I have derived `Serialize` for `NetConnection` to support debugging it in [amethyst-editor-sync](https://github.com/randomPoison/amethyst-editor-sync).

### Possible future extensions:
Serializing `send_buffer` and `receive_buffer` depends on https://github.com/randomPoison/amethyst-editor/issues/23.

I do not think it would be good idea to serialize `send_reader`, but it might be worth using it to report how many `NetEvent`s are yet to be send, using something like `ExactSizeIterator::len(&send_buffer.read(&mut send_reader))`. That would need https://github.com/randomPoison/amethyst-editor-sync/issues/7

labels.name: type: improvement
labels.description: An improvement or change to an existing feature.

title: Fix MacOS 10.14 nothing rendering until resize

labels.name: type: bug
labels.description: Something is not working as it should.

labels.name: pri: critical
labels.description: This issue has to be fixed ASAP. For the owning team, nothing else should be worked on.

body:
This fix adds window resize to happen after window creation on macos
and opengl. This is a work around proposed in #972. This fix should be
temporary until there is a fix upstream. This shouldn't affect users
as the resize happens only after window creation and only then. This
closes #972.

title: Add TextureMetadata::srgb_scale for defaults with nearest filter

labels.name: type: improvement
labels.description: An improvement or change to an existing feature.

body:
Linear interpolation filter (current new default for `TextureMetadata::srgb()`) plays bad with sprites. 2D setups usually use nearest filter. The PR restores old behavior for sprites examples.

* Added new function `TextureMetadata::srgbScale()`
* Pong tutorial is adjusted to use nearest filter 
* Sprites examples are adjusted to use nearest filter 
* Added note in book when to use srgbScale

How to check:
* Check examples pong_tutorial_*, sprites, sprites_ordered
* Check docs

title: fix: TexturePrefab had code that was unreachable, not marked as such.…
body: And AssetPrefab should load files in load_sub_assets, not in add_to_entity. Fixes #979. --- This change is [](https://reviewable.io/reviews/amethyst/amethyst/1020)

title: Remove unwrap() in a few places
body:
Let me know if I should put these in smaller PR's or larger ones.

Part of #908

title: Implement configurable line width for debug lines
body:
Problem: debug lines are too thin for orthographic projection with large top/bottom/left/right ranges (usually used for 2D setups).

Solution:
* Use uniform for line width.
* Pass line width via resource.

Also added the usage of the new feature to example.

How to test:
* Change `DebugLinesParams` in `debug_lines` example and run

title: Added shadow_update and shadow_fixed_update to the State trait
body:
Regarding Issue #1005 `[RFC] 'shadow_update' ...`
Added shadow_update and shadow_fixed_update to the State trait, but not EmptyState nor SimpleState.

Maybe it's easier to understand what I meant in the Issue.

Currently these functions are also called on the active State.

This should both:

- Encourage contributing on doc (and hopefully then on code)
- Increase traffic to our subreddit as it will now be mentioned in the book

title: Derive Serialize (and other traits) for more types
body: I've derived `Serialize` impls for a number of types in order to support displaying them in the editor via [amethyst-editor-sync](https://github.com/randomPoison/amethyst-editor-sync). I've also derived various other commonly-used traits where appropriate. Please let me know if any of these traits shouldn't be added, or if there are any other traits you think I should go ahead and add as part of this PR 🙂

title: [Feature] Hidden component and System

labels.name: type: feature
labels.description: A request for a new feature.

body:
A simple `Hidden` component that allows hiding an entity,
and a `HideHierarchySystem` (based on `UiTransformSystem`)  that propagates the `Hidden` changes through all children.

title: Fix for dragging between monitors with different DPIs

labels.name: type: bug
labels.description: Something is not working as it should.

body:
If you drag from a monitor with high dpi (Macbook Retina screen in my case) to a lower dpi external monitor the screen doesn't update and you end up seeing the top left quarter of the picture.

I copied the logic around the window size: adding cached_hidpi_factor to the renderer struct and comparing this to the current dpi in the draw method.

Hopefully pretty straightforward change but please let me know your thoughts. I'm new to rust so feel free to critique whatever implementation decisions I've made :)

title: feat: Enable users to control what events get pushed to the states

labels.name: type: improvement
labels.description: An improvement or change to an existing feature.

body: Adds EventReader, which is a trait that abstract event reading. The primary user for this is to make it configurable what events get read by Application and sent to the States. Also added a new derive crate, which a derive macro for creating an EventReader for an aggregated event enum. This change is [](https://reviewable.io/reviews/amethyst/amethyst/996)

title: Bumped dependency versions.

labels.name: type: improvement
labels.description: An improvement or change to an existing feature.

body:
```
ron             0.2   -> 0.4
shred           0.5   -> 0.7
bincode         0.9   -> 1.0
uuid            0.5.1 -> 0.7.1
thread_profiler 0.1   -> 0.3
image           0.19  -> 0.20
clipboard       0.4   -> 0.5
```

Tried bumping `fluent` from `0.2 -> 0.4`, but `MessageContext -> FluentBundle` is no longer `Send + Sync`, so I kept it as it is.

Hopefully this speeds up compilation times re:building multiple versions of dependencies.

title: Add workaround for Wayland issues

labels.name: type: bug
labels.description: Something is not working as it should.

body:
Addresses #890 

This just asks winit to use X11 instead of Wayland.

Known side effect: if no dimensions are specified, the default window size on Wayland will differ from the one on X11

title: Summarized all `use amethyst::` statements in examples to allow collapsing

labels.name: type: improvement
labels.description: An improvement or change to an existing feature.

body:
Opening some of the examples on my Laptop instantly flooded my screen with use-statements.

That's not very helpful if you want to research/look up how to do something specific, normally you first look at how it's done and then WHERE the stuff you need is. (Sadly, rust doesn't allow `use` statements after the implementation).

Summarizing all use statements of the same crates allows collapsing in IDEs, making examples more accessible, without having to scroll a whole page.

title: Base Networking implementation

labels.name: type: feature
labels.description: A request for a new feature.

body:
This PR is in reference to #335. This PR originates from #665 and #532, this also stems from @jojolepro work in both those PRs.

This provides an initial implementation for networking just presenting the most basic way of communicating to a server and client that can be integrated into an amethyst application. In its current state, the only working example is `net_server` and `net_client`. When run at the same time, they send messages back and forth. There is also some commented code, mainly in the components folder of the `amethyst_network` crate due to not fitting the scope of the base implementation, but will be worked on after this PR is merged.

Opening this for inital review and comments.

Once, we agree this is good to go, I will add the changelog entry and squash.
